definition[0]: in or under the sea and not far from the coast
definition[1]: involving an activity performed outside a particular country, rather than inside it
example[2]: Taiwanese regulators have been unhappy with offshore trading in its stock futures.
definition[2]: a bank etc that is based in a country where taxes are lower, laws are less strict etc
example[3]: He had transferred the money from Switzerland to accounts in offshore banks.
example[4]: firms based in loosely-regulated offshore financial centres
definition[3]: connected with oil and gas production that is done on or under the sea
definition[4]: if a company offshores jobs or an activity, it moves them to a foreign country where costs are lower
example[6]: Some 3,000 formerly British jobs have been offshored each year since the millennium.
